observations: Approximated data population attempted via SQL.
name: exercises.archetype_id

name: public.exercise_muscle_groups

observations: SQL function to fetch weekly exercise sets per muscle group and archetype for a user.

SELECT
    trim(split_part(ma.name, '(', 1)) AS calculated_base_archetype_name,
    CASE
        WHEN ma.name LIKE '%(\%)\%' THEN
            trim(regexp_replace(regexp_substr(ma.name, '\\('.*?\\)'), '[()]', '', 'g'))
        ELSE
            NULL
    END AS calculated_archetype_subtype_name,
    md.name AS muscle_name,
    COUNT(es.id) AS sets_count
FROM
    public.exercise_sets es
JOIN
    public.workout_exercises we ON es.workout_exercise_id = we.id
JOIN
    public.workouts w ON we.workout_id = w.id
JOIN
    public.exercises ex ON we.exercise_id = ex.id
JOIN -- Changed from1 LEFT JOIN to JOIN: an exercise must have an archetype to contribute to this volume calculation
    public.movement_archetypes ma ON ex.archetype_id = ma.id
JOIN -- An exercise must be mapped to specific muscles to be included
    public.exercise_muscle_groups emg ON ex.id = emg.exercise_id
JOIN
    public.muscle_definitions md ON emg.muscle_definition_id = md.id
WHERE
    w.user_id = p_user_id
    AND w.completed = TRUE
    AND es.completed = TRUE -- Count only completed sets for volume
    AND w.created_at >= (CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '7 days') -- Calculate for the last 7 days
    -- AND ex.archetype_id IS NOT NULL -- This is implicitly handled by the JOIN to movement_archetypes
GROUP BY
    calculated_base_archetype_name,
    calculated_archetype_subtype_name,
    muscle_name;
name: fetch_weekly_sets_per_muscle_group_rpc

name: src/pages/Home.tsx
SunMoonProgress
observations: Located at src/components/core/charts/SunMoonProgress.tsx
Displays progress with a sun/moon icon transition.
Background div was removed to make it transparent.
Progress bar size can be configured via barSize prop.
Text displaying percentage and hours/goal hours is hidden when progress reaches 100% or is below 5%.
At 100% progress, the sun icon initiates a 'sunburst' animation: it spins continuously (4s duration) and scales up slightly (1.25x).
The sun icon's central glow also pulses at 100% progress (2s duration).
CSS keyframes for 'sun-spin-scaled' and 'pulse-glow' are defined within the component.
Animation logic updated for a one-time 'sunburst' effect upon reaching 100% progress.
Uses `runBurstAnimation` state, triggered by `useEffect` with a 700ms delay after progress hits 1.
New CSS keyframes `sunBurstEffect` (1.5s, scales, spins once, settles at scale(1.35)) for the main sun icon.
New CSS keyframes `sunGlowBurstEffect` (1.5s, pulses scale/opacity, settles) for the sun's central glow.
Animations play once and hold the final frame (`forwards`).
Continuous spinning animations have been removed; the sun is static after the burst.
Misalignment of central glow during animation was identified as a transform-origin issue.
cx/cy attributes of the glow circle were reverted to 12.
Located at src/pages/Home.tsx
Renders SunMoonProgress and CircularProgresDisplay components.
name: Home Page
SunMoonProgress Style
observations: Component background should be transparent to blend with app background.
Progress bar thickness is adjustable.
Includes 'sun-spin-scaled' keyframe animation for rotation and scaling.
Includes 'pulse-glow' keyframe animation for opacity pulsing.
Replaced continuous spin/pulse with finite burst animations: `sunBurstEffect` and `sunGlowBurstEffect`.
Animations are designed for a one-time celebratory effect.

Set `transform-origin: center;` and `transform-box: fill-box;` for `animate-sunBurstEffect` and `animate-sunGlowBurstEffect` CSS classes to ensure animations scale/rotate from the elements' visual center.
Reverted cx/cy of glow circle to 12, as misalignment was due to animation transform-origin, not static positioning.
Located at src/components/features/Nutrition/SunExposureLogging.tsx
Used for logging daily sun exposure.
Input changed from a single decimal field to two separate integer fields: one for hours, one for minutes.
Handles form submission, validation, and API mutation for saving sun exposure data.

src/components/features/Coach/WorkoutGeneratorButton.tsx
observations: Component has a button that generates a strength workout.
User reported that workout generation works on desktop but not on mobile.
The button text appears gray but is clickable.
Added console logging for `baseExercises`, `muscleGroupMappings`, and `exercisesWithMuscleGroups` to debug data fetching on mobile.
Added a state variable `generationStatusMessage` to display errors to the user if workout generation fails.

Modified the `exercisesWithMuscleGroups` memoization to handle cases where `muscleGroupMappings` might be null or undefined on mobile. Instead of returning an empty array immediately, it now treats `muscleGroupMappings` as an empty object `{}` in such cases, allowing `baseExercises` to still be processed with empty `muscle_groups` arrays.
This file also contains a workout generator but seems to use a different logic (archetypes) compared to WorkoutGeneratorButton.tsx (muscle groups).
User mentioned this file in the context of the problem, but the specific issue described points to WorkoutGeneratorButton.tsx.
name: src/components/features/Coach/WorkoutGenerator.tsx
